intro: Cryptandra complicata, commonly known as the complex cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. Due to its restricted distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
